result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J. Noland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall pay at least $50.00 a month towards his restitution.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.  Defendant shall write a letter of apology to the victim due within 30 days and preapproved by probation.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  Defendant will be eligible for expungement upon successful completion of probation.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael J. Noland

probation

Defendant Michael J. Noland in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE is asking to be released from probation and sentenced.  Parties are in agreement.  Court orders to vacate sentence. Parties make statement on sentence. Court orders payment of court costs; DNA surcharge of $619.54 with amount to be entered as a civil judgment. ba
to Schedule a Sentencing Hearing
DOC Face Sheet Intake and Investigation
Restitution Summary
of TA

Defendant Michael J. Noland in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Victim rights complied with.  Plea of no contest to criminal damage to property.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Statement by counsel.  Court orders withheld sentence - probation for one year; court costs; restitution in the amount of $1,410.00 plus surcharge with payments of a least $50.00 a month; $53.99 service of process fees; DNA sample and surcharge; letter of apology to TA due within 30 days and preapproved by probation; counseling as deemed appropriate by probation. Defendant would be eligible for expungement upon successful completion of probation.  - rt
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 11, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Alec Phillip Nocco in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No appearance by defendant.  It is now 10:25 am.  Attorney Nocco has not been able to reach his client.  Attorney Nocco is requesting that the warrant be stayed until Friday.  Court issues warrant but stays it until 4:30 today.  - rt
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-16-2016 09:00 am
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Michael J. Noland in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of complaint.  Plea of not guilty to all charges.  Court orders $500.00 signature bond; with booking.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 01:00 pm.  - rt
*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.
